Description: Head of Augustus, bare, right; below, capricorn right. (obverse)
State: Associated with: Roman Empire Ancient Greece and Rome: Roman Empire
Curator's comments: This denarius celebrates the successful conclusion of Octavian's Egyptian campaign. The conquest the Ptolemaic kingdom of Egypt in August 30BC removed the last obstacle to Octavian's achievement of supreme power in the Roman world. In 29 BC, Octavian returned to Rome for his official triumph (a triple one, primarily celebrating his successes at Actium and Alexandria but also in Illyricum) and in the following year this coin picturing a crocodile with the inscription AEGVPTO CAPTA celebrated the event.
Mint uncertain. In Bibliothèque National de France’s catalogue (BNCMER Auguste) mint attributed to Pergamum
Bibliographic references: RIC1 / The Roman Imperial Coinage, vol. 1 (545, p.86) (type)
